ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Polar Plasma Wave Instrument, High Frequency Waveform Receiver, 25kHz bandwidth, 6-channel fields
ResourceHeader.Description:
PWI>Plasma Wave Instrument
Reference: Gurnett, D.A. et al, The Polar plasma wave instrument, Space Science Reviews, Vol. 71, pp. 597-622, 1995. donald-gurnett@uiowa.edu
An FFT on 1024 values was used in calibrating the data; i.e., perform FFT, calibrate in frequency domain, perform inverse FFT to get calibrated time series.
Coordinate System Used: local magnetic field-aligned, a spacecraft centered coordinate system where Z is parallel to the local B-field determined from Polar MFE, X points outward and lies in the plane defined by the Z-axis and the radial vector from the earth to the spacecraft, and Y completes a right-handed system and points eastward. The X- and Z-axes are contained in the north-south plane.
Effective Bandwidth is 1.5*delta_f, where delta_f depends on the size of the FFT used to convert to the frequency domain, and delta_t. These data come in snapshots of 31816 points per channel, every 9.2 seconds, where the duration of each snapshot is 0.045 seconds. Since Epoch time is in milliseconds, the times for the data points will not be unique unless the Delta_T in milliseconds is added to the Epoch time for the snapshot.
The data in this file will be in sets of 31744 (31*1024) points per channel because the FFT size does not come out even within the number of points per snapshot. To obtain the time for each point in the snapshot, increment each Epoch time after the first with Delta_T (in ms).

InformationURL.Name: Polar Plasma Wave Investigation (PWI) Data and User's Guides
InformationURL.Description: A Polar PWI page is maintained at the University of Iowa with descriptions of interpretation issues, user's guides, data availability tables, a form for creating summary plots and access to pregenerated dynamic spectrograms.

AccessURL.Name: POLAR PWI H7 data web access
AccessURL.Description: HTTP access to directories with Polar PWI H7 data files

NumericalData.Keyword: CDF Global Attribute TITLE: POLAR PWI HFWR
CDF Global Attribute MISSION_GROUP: Polar CDF Global Attribute MISSION_GROUP: Magnetospheric Data
CDF Global Attribute PROJECT: ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
CDF Global Attribute DISCIPLINE: Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
CDF Global Attribute DATA_TYPE: H7>HFWR 6-channel, 1.5 usec
CDF Global Attribute MODS: Created Jan 2004

Parameter.Name: Time
Parameter.Description: Time, start time of HFWR snapshot
Parameter.Caveats: Gain changes may occur at these times

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR Channel 1 (Ex)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.
Parameter.Description: Channel 1 Gain (HFWR)

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR Channel 2 (Ey)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.
Parameter.Description: Channel 2 Gain (HFWR)

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR Channel 3 (Ez)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.
Parameter.Description: Channel 3 Gain (HFWR)

Parameter.Name: Gain for HFWR M-Field (Bx, By, Bz)
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation.
Parameter.Description: M Gain (HFWR)

Parameter.Name: HFWR Elec. Field Antenna Ex
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ex (perp and outward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ex (perp and outward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords)
Parameter.Caveats: When FFT is applied, Filter Rolls off at 25 kHz

Parameter.Name: HFWR Elec. Field Antenna Ey
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ey (perp and eastward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords).
Parameter.Description: HFWR Elec Field Antenna Ey (perp and eastward in Local-Field Aligned/LFA coords)
Parameter.Caveats: When FFT is applied, Filter Rolls off at 25 kHz

Parameter.Name: DATA_QUALITY Ex
Parameter.Set: This parameter is in the set of parameters that depends on the CDF column with the Parameter Key, EPOCH, to specify the Time of Observation. EPOCH Catalog Description (CATDESC): Data Quality for Ex components (0 = OK, 1 = clipped or questionable).
Parameter.Description: Data Quality for Ex components (0 = OK, 1 = clipped or questionable)
